name: Eurostars Dylan Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to NYC for a wedding in September and all the hotels were really expensive since it was the high season. Luckily we found a relatively good deal online for the Dylan hotel, and since it was near the wedding venue, we decided to try it out. The hotel is quite small and close to the Grand Central station, but it is easy to walk pass it without realising it because the entrance is quite discreet. We did not spend a lot of time at the hotel because we were out with friends most of time, but in general, we found the service very friendly and efficent esp. the porters/ doormen.
reviews.title: Plesant surprise!

reviews.text: The room was decent for NY standard, everything was modern and quite minimalist. The bathroom was a bit disappointing because there was no bath tub and not much room to put our toiletries.
reviews.title: mixed reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat in the hotel, but I have been to the bar previously and thought the cocktails and snacks were good. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and we would considering returning someday soon!
reviews.title: Fab Location!

likes.liked: — Location, front desk staff v. helpful

reviews.text: we stayed at the Dylan for 3 nigths on a girl getaway. It's in a great location and the staff is very pleasant. But I'm glad we booked through Venere.com and only paid 259$/night. The rack rate was above 500$. The room was a bit worn out, in need of painting and a fresh carpet, but very clean. I'm only saying, try to get it on a discount web site instead of paying full price.
reviews.title: Stay at the Dylan - let Liza sort it all out
My Favourite Place Ever
reviews.text: For a first trip to NY this hotel was in a perfect location! It's right in the middle of everywhere you want to get to - 5th Ave, Times Square, Rockefeller etc but at the same time is tucked away enough to give a good nights sleep.. no street noise for us - although we were on the back of the hotel and had the constant hum of the air con in the background and the room had little natural light. However we were up and out breakfast to midnight so not too concerned. Would recommend this hotel to friends.

reviews.title: great place
reviews.text: I had had some real panic after reading the reviews. The staff was wonderful. They were always there to help call a cab or a car for us , asking if we needed anything. The rooms was just what we thought it would be. My husband and I were there for our anniversary and the dinning staff was wonderful to us. We will be back!
We stayed at the Dylan from fri-mon, and paid $205/nt on their website.
reviews.title: Dylan average, didn't wow me

reviews.text: I have stayed in several hotels in Manhattan, for business & pleasure, and thought the Dylan was average. If you get a good rate here, it might be worth it. But don't expect comfy duvets or a special stay. (See pics.)
reviews.title: Better than expected!

reviews.text: We stayed in a standard room, which was the usual small size for NYC. Our 11th floor room had a window, but not a view. There were three adults in our room, which seemed snug. With no overhead lighting, only bedside lamps, the room was poorly lit.
reviews.title: Eye contact goes a long way.....

reviews.text: The bathroom was slightly odd. There was no place to set your personal toiletries (see pics), and it was nearly impossible to wash your face in the sink. There are no towel rails, and only one hook. The shower also had poor water pressure, and once even stopped working in the middle of my shower. (It returned quickly after.)
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in early June 2006 & really enjoyed the room. Much more spacious & clean over other hotels we've stayed at in NYC. We booked over the Internet & paid for a king but they initially installed us in a room with a Queen. It took 2 phone calls to Reception plus a visit and a wait of over an hour to get moved. This was the only glitch in an otherwise very nice stay. The staff were very nice & the bellboys did a fantastic job getting us a taxi when it was pouring rain in Friday rush hour. The beds & linens are excellent and the dark curtains made for a long slepp; the bathrobes & slippers are a nice touch. Only 2 complaints about were the bathroom is short of counter/storage space for toiletries and the constant hum of HVCA systems is rather noisy, but it's constant so we still managed to sleep through it. We generally found it very quiet there & since we live in the countryside & not in a city, we are used to extreme quiet so we slept well. It's very close to Grand Central Stn which is great. There aren't many good class restaurants in the area so you have to travel to find somewhere to eat for dinner. We found a great food market in Grand Central plus a wine store there. We did eat at their restaurant one evening & had a reasonably decent, altho expensive, meal. I would certainly return to this hotel & would recommend it to others.
reviews.title: 2 thumbs up for Dylan

reviews.text: i stayed here for 1 week for business.
reviews.title: great location
Great location, Great Value
reviews.text: i had also read the somewhat dubious reviews and so was a little wary of staying there.
firstly it is a boutique hotel so it is smaller and less "grand" than the big chains. but thats ok if you aren't spending the whole day in.
reviews.title: Good location, good staff, okay rooms

reviews.text: the staff on sunday were a little sparse but ok. during the weekdays they were more lively and helpful
reviews.title: Great location in the middle of it all
Staff could Care Less
reviews.text: The Dylan Hotel although equipped with nice hotel rooms, could care less whether you had a good stay. They do not greet with smiles, nor do they offer you a guide to the surrounding city. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived and our luggage was checked. This meant it was set out in the open in the lobby foyer. Overall, the rooms are nice, but the staff is lacking in hotel hospitality.
I'm going to echo the sentiments of several others. The hotel itself was fine - comfortable rooms, roomy bathroom, great location.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, awful staff

reviews.text: I thought the front desk staff was aloof and unhelpful. (The door man -- a cute little guy with a shaved head -- was great, though.)
reviews.title: Cost a few Bob, and not worth it

reviews.text: It seemed like the hotel operations weren't organized particularly well, either. We were scheduled to have 8 people staying in two rooms, so double beds were an obvious "must have." When we checked in at noon, we were told that there were no double rooms available even though we had booked our trip several months in advance. So each room had four people and one bed - not so comfortable considering how much we were paying to stay there.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: In addition, we weren't able to check into our first room until 5:00, and we weren't given our second room until 6:30 -- a problem since our dinner reservation was at 7:00. Imagine 8 girls trying to crowd around one mirror to get ready for a night out.
reviews.title: Great location, no surprises
Average at Best
reviews.text: There are a wealth of options in Manhattan, even the Library Hotel (which, incidentally is a terrific hotel) just across the street at comparable rates. Unless otherwise compelled by business, I would not stay here. It may have once been a hip, urban boutique hotel, however, it has lost its shine. The hotel is dark, dirty and tired. My room faced the back of the hotel, therefore, all evening I listened to the persistent loud hum of the ventilation system. If you must stay at the back of the hotel, insist to be on at least the 6th floor. The towels are thin and gray. The bed comfortable enough, but do not expect more than a double sheeted thin blanket. The closet barely holds the 2 robes the hotel provides. All the furniture corners are chewed. Staff is nice enough, however, management should start thinking about spending some real money on a soft renovation. I have lived in Manhattan for a number of years, and return often for business . . . keep looking.

After reading the other reviews, I was looking forward to staying at the Dylan and had booked two separate stays there. However, my family and I were very disappointed. The staff was welcoming at check-in and nice in general. The room was an adequate size with tall ceilings. We had a "double double" and one bed was collapsed in the middle. The room was generally rather run down, dingy and dreary, with low wattage light bulbs in too few lamps. The bathroom was very small, with no place to put toiletries or even to hang towels once they were used. The cold water faucet at the sink turned the wrong way so when we would turn it to shut off the water, water would gush out. Given the shape of the sink, the water sprayed all over (on us and on the floor) until we got used to turning it the wrong way to shut it off. The room generally was not comfortable and we were glad to leave. I would not consider this to be a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. Needless to say, I cancelled our second reservation.
reviews.title: Disappointing Dylan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff - helpful and courteous - a brilliant location too. The building is lovely and the dining room/restaurant is has loads of original features. We stayed there on the first night of our first trip to New York after our flight being delayed for hours. When we arrived absolutely starving, the receptionist directed us to a deli which was still open at Midnight and we had the most delicious sandwich which we still talk about to this day. Really close to Grand Central Station, The Library, Chrysler Building and a walk to Times Square and the Empire State Building. A lovely hotel - I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in Midtown and do sight seeing.
reviews.title: Great hotel in midtown

reviews.text: After a terrible experience at another hotel close by, we chose the Dylan for its good reviews and affordability. It ended up being the best part of our trip! The modern theme of this boutique hotel does not take away from its comfort with a great layout, space and furniture. Because it was so affordable for NYC, we opted for the executive suite and had plenty of room for two travellers with a lot of luggage. There was even a cozy sofa with pullout as part of the full living room set up. The decor was amazing, a cute, mod layout with cooling blues and greens made for a luxuriously calming retreat after a day of running around the city -- we were actually excited to return early to our room! The staff downstairs was SO friendly and accomadating! When we told them our horror story down the street, they let us check in hours early and offered to send up special amenities to help us "relax". They were also available to offer great suggestions for dining during our stay. Good location, and easy walk to Times Square and just a skip to Grand Central, although most businesses in the immediate area were closed for the weekend as it seems to be in a business district. Overall, great great space to come back to after a busy day in the city. It may not be the cheapest hotel in the city, but definately the best value!! We didn't want to leave!
reviews.title: Nirvana in New York City!

likes.liked: — Great service, beautiful and cozy rooms, good location. Modern luxury!
likes.disliked: — You will have to walk a couple blocks to find food after 5p.m. and on weekends

reviews.text: We stayed at the Dylan for two nights at $289 per night via hotelconnextions.com. It was terrific at that price and hard to come by in NYC these days. The room was small but very clean as was the bathroom. The best part was the quiet. Many hotels can't insulate out the street noise. We didn't hear a thing...in the hall or street. It is a small place so there aren't groups of tourists and all that goes with large chain hotels. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Dylan was such a wonderful experience for a first time NYC traveler. After overpacking I was very pleased to find that Grand Central was litterly a 1-2 minute walk from the hotel. When we checked in to our room it was very nice, but way to hot... THe room was litterly 95 degrees. I called down to the front desk and they happily gave us a different room. The first impression of the rooms there are CLEAN!! all the bedding is white and the bathroom shines!! The staff was kind and very helpful. They got us cabs if we needed it, made dinner reservations for us and gave us tips about the city. We ate dinner one night at the resturant in the hotel, we ordered the steak for two and it was hands down the best steak we both have ever had!! One of our friends lives in the city and came up to our room, she had never heard of our hotel and was very surpirsed to find the room very large at a reasonable price. I would highly recommened this hotel and I will personally be staying here again!!
reviews.title: exceeded expectations

reviews.text: Generally friendly staff doesn't make up for the total lack of daylight and bathrooms the size of closets...
reviews.title: Skip it...

reviews.text: My cousin and I planned our first trip to NYC for Thanksgiving week. We narrowed down the list of hotels from a few websites with photos. WOW, were we duped!!!
reviews.title: do not judge the book by its cover - it's not as good as it looks

likes.liked: — location - E 41st street is very central to where we went

reviews.text: Dylan Hotel online photos fooled us. We thought it would be an art-decco hotel with neon lights and San Francisco comfort. We had a double room (2 double beds) and the beds were comfortable. Plenty of storage space in the room for clothes (dresser drawers and closet). But the TV didn't receive local stations (on Thanksgiving week - didn't get to see TODAY show!) But the bathroom was a joke. Spacious enough for walking around in, but no counter space for toiletries, the sink and faucet were mismatched sizes so every time you turned on the sink faucet, your feet were wet because of the spatter. The shower curtain didn't quite cover the tub, so there was constantly water on the floor. We had to dry our hair and apply make up in the bedroom in front of the full length mirror because the bathroom didn't have any counter space. Ugh...
reviews.title: Great service, great location & great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was helpful enough and the restaurant was excellent. I just wouldn't stay here a second time for $358/night. We did like the location, felt safe the entire time. But will look for different accommodations for our next trip in March 07.
reviews.title: Great hotel, location, rooms and freindly staff !!!
Staffed by the Surlys
reviews.text: The rooms are New York small, and noisy on the street side. But they are clean and pleasant enough. Trying very hard to be hip.

reviews.title: Not quite the boutique experience
reviews.text: The problem with the Dylan is that staff couldn't care less what happens to you. For example, the internet connection is free, but there is nothing in the room to tell you about it (it has both ethernet and wi-fi connections, but you only know that by trial and error). Tried to leave a wake up call with the automated system, it didn't work. Tried the operator at 11:00PM, no answer. Left the wake up call with the front desk. In the morning, no wake up call, no receipt upon checkout and no help getting a taxi on narrow 41st Street.
For the same money, you can get an entry level room at the Waldorf and will be much happier.
reviews.title: Hated It
Great Little Boutique Hotel near Everything
reviews.text: I was fairly disappointed with this hotel. I travel frequently to NY and have stayed in all different type of hotels from boutique to large chain in the city and I haven't been this disappointed in a hotel in quite a long time.

reviews.title: A real find
reviews.text: First the positive:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I met my wife here, who was here on business/pleasure, on a Saturday after she had been here 2 nights already. I stayed only one night. The staff was great. They were courteous, helpful and accommodating. The room was as expected for Manhattan, small. The décor was stylishly modern with really high ceilings. The bathroom was also pretty small with little counter space. We had an interior facing room so not a lot of noise to worry about but at the same time not a lot of natural light. The hotel’s location was perfect for us. Grand Central Station was only 2 blocks away which gave us easy access to the subway. It is also only about 4 blocks from Times Square and about 8 blocks from Rockefeller Center. There was also some shooting for a new Will Smith flick taking place practically outside the lobby. That was fun. The wireless worked ok on the fourth floor which allowed this geek to keep in touch. We never visited the in-house restaurant or bar so we can’t comment on it but they looked quite nice. Overall, our stay was very nice. The limited space aside, we were happy with our experience.
reviews.title: Thumbs up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the dylan for 3 nights march 2nd -5th. i was really impressed,the staff were all really helpful and polite.
reviews.title: what a lovely hotel

reviews.text: the room was spotless,lovely clean battroom.
reviews.title: Excellent little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i have no faults with it whatsoever
reviews.title: The best!

likes.liked: — The location and 'feel' of the hotel.
likes.disliked: — Pity we didn't get a view...

reviews.text: It was sparkling clean, the rooms were well appointed and very quiet. Since the building used to be the Chemists Club, it was a cute touch to use laboratory beakers as drinking glasses in the bathroom. The location was very convenient and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful
reviews.title: it's ok

likes.liked: — The staff were helpful and friendly
likes.disliked: — the sink and no counter space

description: The Eurostars Dylan Hotel, hotel in Manhattan, unites tradition and modernity exquisitely and with a contemporary elegance that captivates our guests. The building is very emblematic, first having been the residence of the Welsh writer, Dylan Thomas and later, the headquarters of the New York Pharmacists Club. The Eurostars Dylan Hotel combines the classical lounges and guest rooms of the period with ambiances and areas in contemporary design. We are a non-stop hotel, because the Big Apple never stops. For this reason, the gym and the Business Centre are open 24 hours a day.
